page.title: 02BELMONT TELEVISION MAST
page.content: Belmont Television Mast opened in 1965 and from 1965 to 1969 it was a manned station.Now it is visited only every 3 months by maintenance engineers.It is 1265ft high and was built by a company called BICC.It takes 1 hour 30 minutes to climb to the top of the mast, but there is also a lift inside it.The mast goes 20ft underground.Belmont weighs 320 tons.It took 18 months to build.The mast is 9ft across.Independent Broadcasting Authority own the mast,but BBC have shares.In high wind Belmont can sway 2ft each side.Belmont Mast is the tallest in Great Britain.The system that IBA use is called the Oracle.On the 19th November 1966 BBC started at Belmont Television Mast.There are 2 transmitters.The equipment in Belmont will be replaced in 10 years time.Our teacher Mr Doughty climbed up a little
